availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Thomas E. Bramlette,
GOVERNOR OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
TO ALL WHO SHALL SEE THESE PRESENTS, GREETING:
Whereas, a judgment has been rendered by the Kenton Circuit Court for $1000, against Samuel Coleby as surety on Bail Bond of Henry Jones alias Thos L. Hayworth
And Whereas, It appears from satisfactory evidence that the case of the said Coleby presents strong considerations for the interposion of and indulgeance the Executive:

Now Know Ye, That in consideration of the premises, and by virtue of the power vested in me by the Constitution, I have thought proper to REMIT, and do, by these presents remit said judgment except fees and costs -- and do hereby forever aquit, release, and discharge said Thos Coleby from the same, enjoining all officers respect this REMISSION, and govern themselves accordingly.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the seal of the commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort the 27th day of July, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and 65, and in the 74th year of the Commonwealth.

By the Governor:
E, L, Van Winkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
